intro: Limonium zeugitanum, commonly known as the Crimean sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its blue to purple flowers and linear, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and saline soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Limonium zeugitanum is part of the Plumbagaceae family, known for its ability to thrive in dry and salty conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
